In New York, nearly 70 people were rescued from malfunctioning gondolas at a ski mountain, while the cold weather has resulted in a death toll of 17; additionally, the city faces challenges with icy sidewalks and ongoing investigations into various municipal issues.

### Risks & Alerts

- Nearly 70 people rescued from New York ski mountain gondolas after malfunction. - Cold death toll hits 17 as deep freeze continues; residents advised to stay indoors. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxPTjFaSzNBNkJRaVFfY2FZdlY5SUJZVkRwN3VOSkFQZW1PTC11bkx2Zk9ycU9sMGc1VGJvWTlpZmNRZjM3eXBXdXJWSlRlYVhqalNwUEZ1T0RydllkVDJCLXByNEhycS1wM1hya1l5SVR6ZEJrLW45LUxSTWtwdExCX2dMWjg?oc=5)

[↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiggFBVV95cUxQU0U4ZHM3eUpuZGI5ZEF2dmhqTlNjWmtNWWE0X2tqWW5kM1h1TVFzbVZkUW5ILWpHS2ZnZUVBSl9rclFQNWxjYkNWNWhacm5nQmJaNmprejQ2ak15ZlJvcWdmQklyYnpxNE5hOEJyV05CQ19kVTNrLUJmY0RQaFJWeHV3?oc=5)
